questions.question: What is ping?
questions.explanation: Ping: sends ICMP ECHO. Purpose: test reachability. Output: response time. Packet: 32 bytes default. Result: success/timeout. Importance: basic diagnostic.

questions.question: What is traceroute?
questions.explanation: Traceroute: maps network path. Method: TTL increment. Output: intermediate routers. Tool: Windows (tracert), Linux (traceroute). Purpose: route analysis. Importance: routing diagnostic.

questions.question: What is ipconfig?
questions.explanation: ipconfig: shows IP settings. Information: IP, gateway, DNS. Options: /all (detailed), /renew (DHCP). Platform: Windows. Linux: ifconfig. Importance: network info.

questions.question: What is netstat?
questions.explanation: netstat: shows connections. Information: ports, processes, routing. Options: -a (all), -b (processes). Purpose: connection monitoring. Importance: diagnostic.

questions.question: What is nslookup?
questions.explanation: nslookup: resolves domain. Purpose: DNS testing. Input: domain name. Output: IP address. Interactive: yes. Importance: DNS diagnostic.

questions.question: What is dig?
questions.explanation: dig: detailed DNS query. Platform: Linux/Unix. Output: full DNS response. Records: A, MX, NS, etc. Advantage: more detail than nslookup. Importance: DNS diagnostic.

questions.question: What is telnet?
questions.explanation: Telnet: connects to port. Purpose: test if port open. Syntax: telnet host port. Example: telnet example.com 80. Security: unencrypted. Alternative: nc, netcat. Importance: connectivity test.

questions.question: What is arp?
questions.explanation: arp: maps IP to MAC. Command: arp -a (display table). Purpose: verify ARP mappings. Cache: local results. Diagnostic: ARP issues. Importance: layer 2 diagnostic.

questions.question: What is ifconfig?
questions.explanation: ifconfig: shows IP settings. Platform: Linux/Unix. Information: IP, netmask, MAC. Modern: ip command preferred. Alternative: Windows (ipconfig). Importance: network info.

questions.question: What is route?
questions.explanation: route: shows routing entries. Command: route print (Windows), route (Linux). Purpose: verify routes. Entries: destination, gateway, metric. Importance: routing diagnostic.
